body.p: My passion in art grew from the weekly art classes in primary school even though we would mostly just copy sample images drawn on a blackboard by the Art Teacher.

Discovering artworks of worldâ€™s greatest artists were true sources of inspiration insofar as I would examine their masterpieces meticulously and try to replicate their techniques into my own artwork.

The painting process starts with basic drawing of subject with help of online Grid Drawing Tool. I use this grid drawing tool to retain proportionate dimensions of reference images while enlarging them on canvas.
I first block the major shapes, designs and forms of subject in acrylic while laying the layout of artwork after which I then paint in oil.

I paint landscapes, portraits, wildlife and anything else that catches my eye. Every new painting is a learning experience for me. I feel I have been blessed with a special gift and it is incredibly satisfying to know that I can spread some inspirations and joy around through my artworks.

The medium of my artworks is primarily in oil although I use acrylic for blocking in of my artwork.
The saying 'Practice makes perfect' is definitely true in art insofar as the great art masters have often stressed on 3 underlying words, "PRACTICE, PRACTICE,PRACTICE!!!"
